SEARCH
Package gw.testharness

Interface ISmokeTestHelper

All Superinterfaces:
ISmokeTest
public interface ISmokeTestHelper extends ISmokeTest
Interface defining a Smoke Test "helper". It provides the user with actions that they can do in their scripts There will be environment-specific implementations of this, i.e. one for browser, one for perf, etc

  • Method Details

    • download

      InputStream download(String elementId) throws MalformedURLException, IOException
      Returns an InputStream back after clicking a download widget. Remember to close the InputStream when you are done.
      Parameters:
      elementId - the ID of the Widget whose action will download a File.
      Throws:
      MalformedURLException
      IOException

    • downloadWithoutTimeout

      InputStream downloadWithoutTimeout(String elementId) throws MalformedURLException, IOException
      Returns an InputStream back after clicking a download widget. Remember to close the InputStream when you are done. Has no timeout of max file size. Note: Only use for files that are expected to take a large amount of time to download or are very large in size. If this is not the case, use download(String)
      Parameters:
      elementId - the ID of the Widget whose action will download a File.
      Throws:
      MalformedURLException
      IOException

    • getLastClickedWidgetDownload

      ISmokeTestHelper.WidgetDownload getLastClickedWidgetDownload()
      Accessor for the widget download object (contains input stream and headers) set by a download widget on click()

    • getDownload

      ISmokeTestHelper.WidgetDownload getDownload(String widgetId)
      Accessor for the widget download object set by a download widget on click() OR a deferred download from a specific server-only widget using a docCmd/docAction.

    • upload

      InputStream upload(String elementId, String filePath, File file) throws IOException
      Uploads a single file
      Parameters:
      elementId - the FileInput widget id
      filePath - the name/path of the file
      file - the file itself
      Returns:
      InputStream containing the JSON response of the upload success/failure (this stream should be closed by the caller)
      Throws:
      IOException

    • upload

      InputStream upload(String elementId, Collection<ISmokeTestHelper.FileInfo> fileInfos) throws IOException
      Uploads multiple files
      Parameters:
      elementId - the FileInput widget id
      fileInfos - Collectioninvalid input: '<'ISmokeTestHelper.FileInfo> collection of files and metadata, including the actual content, the name/path, the MIME type and the encoding. Only the File content must be specified, the name/path defaults to the File name, the MIME type to application/octet-stream and the encoding to UTF-8.
      Returns:
      InputStream containing the JSON response of the upload success/failure (this stream should be closed by the caller)
      Throws:
      IOException

    • uploadAssert

      void uploadAssert(String elementId, Collection<ISmokeTestHelper.FileInfo> fileInfos) throws IOException
      Uploads multiple files -- and causes a test failure if all files given are not successfully uploaded
      Parameters:
      elementId - the FileInput widget id
      fileInfos - Collectioninvalid input: '<'ISmokeTestHelper.FileInfo> collection of files and metadata, including the actual content, the name/path, the MIME type and the encoding. Only the File content must be specified, the name/path defaults to the File name, the MIME type to application/octet-stream and the encoding to UTF-8. (this is different from upload() above in that it consumes the InputStream and parses the JSON response from the server.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • getServerData

      String getServerData(String relativeUrl, Map<String,String> parameters)
      Issues a GET request to the given server URL with the given parameters and waits for the response. Useful in performance tests as a way to add load to the server in the same way that the UI might do it. For example ClaimCenter uses it to simulate the load generated by the catastrophe heat map. Should not be used to go to a PCF entry point - use ISmokeTest.goToEntryPoint(String) or ISmokeTest.goToEntryPoint(String, Map) if that is what you want. Normal (non performance) smoke tests should never need to use this method.

      If the request returns a simple text type like text/html or text/plain then then result of the request is returned as a string, otherwise null is returned

      Parameters:
      relativeUrl - the relative URL - typically a simple string like MyServlet.do
      parameters - the parameters to be sent
      Returns:
      contents of response if the response is a simple text format, otherwise null

    • login

      void login(String username, String password)
      Logs in -- to be called from the login page. Example: - SmokeTest.login('aapplegate', 'cc');

    • logout

      void logout()
      Logs out -- can be called from anywhere. Example: - SmokeTest.logout();

    • getTextBySelector

      String getTextBySelector(String ccsSelector)
      Finds the first element on the page matching the given selector and returns all of the text in the matching element. Returns null if no matching element is found.
      Parameters:
      ccsSelector - the selector for the element on the page to match
      Returns:
      returns all of the text within the first matching element, otherwise null Example: - string = SmokeTest.getTextBySelector("#gw-west-panel--children .gw-Wizard--Title"); Note: Used by PerfActions to get the string stored on the west-panel (aka gw-Wizard--SubTitle or gw-Wizard--SubTitle)

    • getCurrentPageName

      String getCurrentPageName()
      Returns the name of the current page

    • getCurrentWorksheetName

      String getCurrentWorksheetName()
      Returns the name of the current worksheet

    • askToContinue

      void askToContinue()
      Asks user if he wants to continue; halts if not. Normally you don't need to call this directly. A default message will be used in the dialog box.

    • askToContinue

      void askToContinue(String message)
      Asks user if he wants to continue; halts if not. Normally you don't need to call this directly. An optional string message can be included in the dialog box; if it's not included then a default will be used.
      Parameters:
      message -

    • refresh

      void refresh()
      Refreshes the current page without clicking or doing anything. The equivalent of the user clicking the "Refresh" button.

    • chooseCancelOnNextConfirmation

      void chooseCancelOnNextConfirmation()
      When a web page normally makes a pop-up "Alert" message box, the smoke test will automatically supress the dialog. It will also do so for so-called "confirm" message boxes, which have both an "OK" and a "Cancel" button. The default behavior is to simulate a click on "OK". This function lets you specify that the cancel button should be clicked. Note that you must call this function before the dialog pops up, or it won't have any effect. Example: - SmokeTest.chooseCancelOnNextConfirmation() SmokeTest.clickButton("some button that pops up a confirm message")

    • saveCurrentPage

      void saveCurrentPage(String fullPathname) throws IOException
      Sames the current page in its raw HTML format.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • writeBinaryFile

      void writeBinaryFile(String fileFullPathname, InputStream is) throws IOException
      Write the data given in the InputStream to the given file. If the file exists, it is overwritten.
      Parameters:
      fileFullPathname -
      is -
      Throws:
      IOException

    • isVisible

      boolean isVisible(String elementId)
      Returns true only if an HTML element exists and is visible on the page for the given element id. Example: 
          if (SmokeTest.isVisible('foo')) {...}
      Parameters:
      elementId - the locator id for the element to check existence and visibility

    • openMenu

      Deprecated.

    • isDisabled

      boolean isDisabled(String elementId)
      Parameters:
      elementId - element id of the widget
      Returns:
      true if widget is disabled, false otherwise. A widget is disabled if it is rendered visually as such, for instance grayed out or read-only.

    • isEditable

      boolean isEditable(String elementId)
      Parameters:
      elementId - element id of the widget
      Returns:
      Returns true if widget is editable. A widget is editable if it is rendered as an edit control. An editable widget may be disabled (available false), read-only or grayed out, however it still shows as editable. Check whether the widget is disabled whether the user can change widget data.
      See Also:
      • isDisabled(String)

    • isDocumentLink

      boolean isDocumentLink(String elementId, String documentId)
      Returns true if the widget found by elementId is a document link (has css class "gw-documentLink" and an action to download a document)

    • setElementInSelectByIndex

      void setElementInSelectByIndex(String elementId, int index)
      Sets the value of a SELECT to the value at the given index in the options.
      Parameters:
      elementId - the ID of the SELECT element
      index - the zero-based index of the value to set

    • setElementInSelectByLabel

      void setElementInSelectByLabel(String elementId, String label)
      Sets the value of a SELECT to the option with the given label. Only use this when the label is less likely to change than the value (e.g., when the value is a bean ID).

    • getDisplayText

      String getDisplayText(String elementId)
      Returns the displayed value of the first element with the given id. This is different from getValue(), which returns the value of a form element.
      Parameters:
      elementId - Alternate name of the element
      Returns:
      A string array of names, including the given name

    • log

      void log(String message)
      Logs a message. This does nothing if the Smoke Test is run from the web, but if it is run from the command line logs the message to stdout. Examples: - SmokeTest.log("Some message"); - SmokeTest.log("Claim number = " + SmokeTest.getVar('ClaimNumber'));
      Parameters:
      message -
